results.title: Recovering from a coronary
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Frank Milton
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a practical rehabilitation program for patients with coronary heart disease (devised at Otago University Medical School and the New Zealand School of Physiotherapy) which has produced encouraging results. Although intended mainly for medical audiences, the film offers advice which would well help to avoid or delay the premature onset of coronary heart disease in the population as a whole.

results.title: Recontre
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Margaret Pettigrew and Laurent Coderre
results.brief_description: Cardboard cutouts explode, twirl, disintegrate and form shapes in a delightful, airy film that describes man’s initiation to life, his journey through it, with its inevitable ups and downs, and his final triumph as the person he struggled to become. Music by Sharon Smith.

results.title: Recognising strabismus
results.brief_description: In this film, opthalmologist John T. Flynn MD, describes and demonstrates the clinical procedure necessary to diagnose strabismus, by applying his “cover test” to infant, adolescent and adult sufferers. Strabismus, or unco-ordinated binocular vision, is a chronic medical condition which can lead to ambliopia (blindness without pathogenic or biological cause); strabismus may also mask a retinal blastoma or other serious ailment. Early diagnosis - especially for childhood sufferers - is crucial if the condition is to be corrected and/or prevented from becoming worse.

results.title: Reckless Kelly (Director's cut)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Yahoo Serious and Warwick Ross
results.brief_description: Reckless Kelly is a biker, a republican, a video rental addict, a man of the 90’s and the last of the great bank-robbing gang left to right the wrongs of the world. And he’s doing it his way; holding up autoteller machines and re-depositing the money into the bank accounts of the poor. Good overcomes evil and justice conquers corruption, when our legendary armour-clad hero ventures from the outback of Australia and heads off to the wild world of Hollywood and Las Vegas. Backed by a hit soundtrack featuring INXS, Divinyls, Yothu Yindi and Mental as Anything. Cast includes Yahoo Serious, Melora Hardin, Alexei Sayle, Hugo Weaving, Kathleen Freeman, John Pinette, Bob Maza.

results.title: Reciprocating behavior (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Science Research Association, Phil Content and Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Because we are all dependent on each other, a voluntary exchange of personal ideas and emotions allows us to develop as individuals. Reciprocating behaviour in the classroom enables the pupils to develop, to become both receiver and giver.

results.title: Recently 2
results.brief_description: In Jochen Kuchen’s playful animated short ‘Recently 2’ a man undertakes a new medical procedure that allows him to see everything inside his body. What he discovers however is an inner world brimming with memories, hopes, dreams and disillusionment. Beautifully conveyed by blending various styles of animation, this evocative work ultimately explores not the building blocks of the body, but those of the soul.
